info.title: LLMHive Orchestrator API
info.description: Multi-model orchestration service for LLM interactions

get.description: Root endpoint for basic verification.

Get the current status of a query.

Returns status information including:
- stage: Current processing stage (e.g., "planning", "model_query", "verification", "complete")
- status: Status of current stage (e.g., "running", "completed", "error")
- model: Current model being used (if applicable)
- progress: Progress percentage (0-100)
- message: Human-readable status message
- timestamp: Last update timestamp

schema.title: Response Get Status Api V1 System  Query Id  Get

post.description:
Update the status of a query.

This endpoint is called internally by the orchestrator to update query status.

schema.title: Response Update Status Api V1 System  Query Id  Post

delete.description: Clear status for a query (cleanup after completion).

schema.title: Response Clear Status Api V1 System  Query Id  Delete

get.description:
Get a subscription by ID.

Final path: /api/v1/billing/subscriptions/{subscription_id}

Get the active subscription for a user.

Final path: /api/v1/billing/subscriptions/user/{user_id}

schema.title: Response Get User Subscription Api V1 Billing Subscriptions User  User Id  Get
Response Get Subscription Info Api V1 Billing Subscription Get

post.description:
Cancel a subscription.

Final path: /api/v1/billing/subscriptions/{subscription_id}/cancel

get.description:
List all available pricing tiers.

Final path: /api/v1/billing/tiers

post.description:
Handle Stripe webhook events.

Final path: /api/v1/billing/webhooks/stripe

This endpoint should be configured in Stripe dashboard to receive webhook events.

schema.title: Response Stripe Webhook Api V1 Billing Webhooks Stripe Post

get.description:
Get usage summary for a user.

Final path: /api/v1/billing/usage/{user_id}

schema.title: Response Get Usage Summary Api V1 Billing Usage  User Id  Get

get.description:
Get usage history for a user.

Final path: /api/v1/billing/usage/{user_id}/history?limit={limit}

schema.title: Response Get Usage History Api V1 Billing Usage  User Id  History Get

get.description:
Check if user's requested usage is within their tier limits.

Final path: /api/v1/billing/usage/{user_id}/limits?requested_tokens={tokens}&requested_models={models}

schema.title: Response Check Usage Limits Api V1 Billing Usage  User Id  Limits Get

get.description:
Estimate monthly cost for a tier and expected usage.

Final path: /api/v1/billing/billing/estimate?tier_name={tier}&estimated_tokens_per_month={tokens}&estimated_requests_per_month={requests}

schema.title: Response Estimate Cost Api V1 Billing Billing Estimate Get

post.description:
Stripe webhook handling: Create a Stripe Checkout session for subscription payment.

This endpoint creates a Stripe Checkout session that redirects the user to Stripe's
hosted payment page. After successful payment, Stripe will send a webhook event.

Final path: /api/v1/payments/create-checkout-session

schema.title: Response Get Checkout Session Api V1 Payments Checkout Session  Session Id  Get

post.description:
Stripe webhook handling: Process Stripe webhook events.

This endpoint receives webhook events from Stripe and updates Firestore.
No SQL database required - uses Firestore for subscription storage.

Final path: /api/v1/webhooks/stripe-webhook

Note: In production, configure this endpoint in Stripe Dashboard:
- Go to Developers > Webhooks
- Add endpoint URL
- Select events: checkout.session.completed, customer.subscription.*, invoice.payment_*
- Copy webhook signing secret to STRIPE_WEBHOOK_SECRET

schema.title: Response Stripe Webhook Api V1 Webhooks Stripe Webhook Post

post.description:
Alias for Stripe webhook at /api/v1/stripe/webhook.

This is an alias route that calls the main stripe_webhook handler.
Configure this URL in your Stripe Dashboard:
https://llmhive-orchestrator-792354158895.us-east1.run.app/api/v1/stripe/webhook

schema.title: Response Stripe Webhook Alias Api V1 Webhooks Webhook Post

post.description:
Stripe webhook handling: Test endpoint to simulate webhook events.

Uses Firestore for storage - no SQL database needed.

Final path: /api/v1/webhooks/stripe-webhook/test?event_type={type}&user_id={id}

Example:
    POST /api/v1/webhooks/stripe-webhook/test?event_type=checkout.session.completed&user_id=user123&tier=pro

schema.title: Response Test Stripe Webhook Api V1 Webhooks Stripe Webhook Test Post

get.description:
Get subscription for a user.

Returns the user's current subscription status from Firestore.

schema.title: Response Get User Subscription Api V1 Webhooks Subscription  User Id  Get

post.description:
Stripe webhook handling: Process Stripe webhook events.

This endpoint receives webhook events from Stripe and updates Firestore.
No SQL database required - uses Firestore for subscription storage.

Final path: /api/v1/webhooks/stripe-webhook

Note: In production, configure this endpoint in Stripe Dashboard:
- Go to Developers > Webhooks
- Add endpoint URL
- Select events: checkout.session.completed, customer.subscription.*, invoice.payment_*
- Copy webhook signing secret to STRIPE_WEBHOOK_SECRET

schema.title: Response Stripe Webhook Api V1 Stripe Stripe Webhook Post

post.description:
Alias for Stripe webhook at /api/v1/stripe/webhook.

This is an alias route that calls the main stripe_webhook handler.
Configure this URL in your Stripe Dashboard:
https://llmhive-orchestrator-792354158895.us-east1.run.app/api/v1/stripe/webhook

schema.title: Response Stripe Webhook Alias Api V1 Stripe Webhook Post

post.description:
Stripe webhook handling: Test endpoint to simulate webhook events.

Uses Firestore for storage - no SQL database needed.

Final path: /api/v1/webhooks/stripe-webhook/test?event_type={type}&user_id={id}

Example:
    POST /api/v1/webhooks/stripe-webhook/test?event_type=checkout.session.completed&user_id=user123&tier=pro

schema.title: Response Test Stripe Webhook Api V1 Stripe Stripe Webhook Test Post

get.description:
Get subscription for a user.

Returns the user's current subscription status from Firestore.

schema.title: Response Get User Subscription Api V1 Stripe Subscription  User Id  Get

post.description:
Submit feedback on an answer.

This feedback is stored in Pinecone for RLHF training.

Request body:
- user_query: The user's question
- answer_text: The answer that was given
- feedback_type: thumbs_up, thumbs_down, or rating
- rating: Optional rating value (1-5 or 0-1)
- model_used: Optional model name

get.description:
Find similar past feedback for a query.

Query params:
- search_query: The query to search for
- positive_only: Only return positive feedback
- limit: Maximum results

Get positive and negative examples for RLHF training.

Query params:
- search_query: The query to find examples for
- num_positive: Number of positive examples
- num_negative: Number of negative examples
Get feedback statistics.

post.description: Check text for spelling errors.
Get spelling suggestions for a word.
Auto-correct text and return corrected version.

get.description:
Basic health check endpoint.

Returns:
    HealthResponse with status and timestamp

Kubernetes liveness probe endpoint.

Returns 200 if the application is running.

schema.title: Response Liveness Probe Api V1 Metrics Health Live Get

get.description:
Kubernetes readiness probe endpoint.

Checks if the application is ready to receive traffic.

schema.title: Response Readiness Probe Api V1 Metrics Health Ready Get

get.description:
Get application metrics.

Returns:
    MetricsResponse with current metrics

Prometheus-compatible metrics endpoint.

Returns metrics in Prometheus text format.

post.description:
Execute Python code in MCP 2 sandbox.

This endpoint provides secure Python code execution with:
- Process isolation
- Resource limits (timeout, memory, CPU)
- Security validation
- Restricted imports

Analyze a file (stub endpoint).

TODO: Implement file analysis functionality:
- Extract text content from various file formats
- Perform code analysis for programming files
- Extract metadata and structure
- Generate summaries and insights

Generate an image from a text prompt (stub endpoint).

TODO: Implement image generation functionality:
- Integrate with DALL-E, Midjourney, Stable Diffusion, or similar
- Support various styles and sizes
- Handle image storage and retrieval
- Provide image editing capabilities

Generate a data visualization (stub endpoint).

TODO: Implement data visualization functionality:
- Support various chart types (bar, line, pie, scatter, etc.)
- Generate interactive charts
- Export to various formats (PNG, SVG, PDF)
- Support real-time data updates

Handle collaboration features (stub endpoint).

TODO: Implement collaboration functionality:
- Share conversations and projects
- Invite collaborators
- Real-time collaboration
- Comments and annotations
- Permission management
- Activity tracking

Chat orchestration endpoint.

Accepts a ChatRequest with prompt, reasoning mode, domain pack, agent mode,
tuning options, metadata, and conversation history.

Returns a ChatResponse with the final answer and orchestration artifacts.

get.description:
List available LLM models/agents.

Returns all known models with their availability status based on
whether the corresponding provider API keys are configured.

Returns:
    AgentsResponse with list of agents and source identifier.

Get current reasoning configuration.

Args:
    user_id: Optional user identifier for per-user config.
    
Returns:
    Current reasoning configuration.

post.description:
Save reasoning configuration.

Args:
    request: The reasoning configuration to save.
    user_id: Optional user identifier for per-user config.
    
Returns:
    Success response with saved configuration.
    
Raises:
    HTTPException: If validation fails.

get.description:
List available reasoning methods.

Returns:
    List of available reasoning method identifiers.

schema.title: Response List Reasoning Methods Reasoning Methods Get

AgentsResponse.title: AgentsResponse
AgentsResponse.description: Response containing list of available agents.

cancel_immediately.title: Cancel Immediately
cancel_immediately.description: Cancel immediately or at period end

criteria.description: Dynamic criteria settings for quality/speed/creativity balance

models.title: Models
models.description: List of model IDs to use for orchestration (e.g., ['gpt-5', 'claude-sonnet-4.5', 'grok-4']). If not provided, models will be auto-selected.

reasoning_method.description: Advanced reasoning method (chain-of-thought, tree-of-thought, react, plan-and-solve, self-consistency, reflexion). If not provided, will be inferred from reasoning_mode.

history.title: History
history.description: Conversation history as list of {role, content} dicts

example.prompt: What is the capital of France?

models_used.title: Models Used
models_used.description: List of models that participated in orchestration

example.message: The capital of France is Paris.
